Text: ASMEOMAEHouston REMINDER OMAE Deepwater Short Coursepst AMERICAN SOCIETY OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERS Ocean Offshore Arctic Engineering Division OMAE Houston Chapter Presents DEEPWATER MARGINAL FIELD DEVELOPMENT SHORT COURSE February April Thursday Evenings TIMES pm LOCATION SHELL BELLAIRE TECHNOLOGY CENTER AUDITORIUM Bellaire Boulevard Inside Loop COST ASME members Nonmembers Emphasis will be on providing insight into the technical and commercial issues and solutions as well as the decisionmaking processes associated with the development of marginal fields in deep water The course shall focus on actual issues that arise in the development of such fields and shall draw on case studies and practical examples to highlight the significance of the issues identify the different potential courses of action and demonstrate the reasoning behind each course of action being selected Cost of the course includes session notes publications binders and sandwich dinner Each registrant who completes the course may request a Certificate of Completion and CEU credit Full refunds will be made for cancellations received fifteen days prior to the first meeting of the seminar Cancellations received after that date are subject to a cancellation fee No refunds will be made after the first meeting Reservations are transferable at no charge upon written notice received prior to the first meeting A refund will be made to each registrant who applies for ASME membership before completion of the seminar Proceeds from OMAE Houston courses are used to fund scholarships at universities for Mechanical Engineering students Registration fees must be paid prior to the first class meeting DEEPWATER MARGINAL FIELD DEVELOPMENT SHORT COURSE February Drivers Majors view Independents view Development Planning Overview March Exploration Reservoir Characterization Drilling Completions March Floating Facilities Subsea Systems Flow Assurance Facility Selection March Export Offtake Construction Installation March HSE Regulatory Issues Operability April Marginal Field Development Case Studies Course Outline divisionsooaehtccourseoutlinehtml Speakers include David Clarke bp Chuck Meloy Kerr McGee Lynn Whitworth CSOAker Ellen Coopersmith Decision Frameworks Irv Brooks Chevron Jim Maher CSOAker Paul Beer Ocean Energy Herve DeNaurois TotalFinaElf Chuck Stuebe Conoco Todd Grove ABS and John
